item.title: Humble Choice Games for February 2025 Explained
item.description:
January 2025 has finally come to a close and February has begun, which means it is time for a whole new bundle of games from Humble Bundle's Humble Choice subscription service. For $11.99, Humble Choice subscribers can grab eight unique titles for their Steam libraries that they can then keep forever. While these adventures offer something for everyone, the best part of this service is that 5% of each subscription will go to charity, with this month supporting the United Negro College Fund, which provides college scholarships and helps fund 37 historically black colleges and universities.

This month, subscribers are being treated to a wide variety of experiences, with some offering virtually countless hours of fun. Strategy fans have Total War: Pharaoh and Tales & Tactics to look forward to, those looking to build their own fantasy city can turn to Fabledom , and anyone looking for some classic action-adventure fun can check out Immortals of Aveum . No matter what type of adventure players are looking for, Humble Choice seems to have it.

Humble Choice Has Some Exciting Adventures In Store This February

All the Games from Humble Choice February 2025

  • Fabledom
  • Griftlands
  • Immortals of Aveum
  • My Little Universe
  • Naheulbeuk's Dungeon Masters
  • Tales & Tactics
  • Total War: Pharoh Dynasties
  • Trepang2

The biggest title in this month's Humble Choice comes in the form of the single-player FPS Immortals of Aveum . Players step into the shoes of Jak, a member of an elite order of battlemages that hope to save the world. What ensues is a frantic adventure that sees players master all sorts of powerful magic to devastate countless foes as they fight to uncover the mysteries of this world's past to protect its future. Anyone who wants to take this title for a spin will need to ensure they have an Origin account, as it does not come as a Steam key.

The other headlining title in this month's Humble Choice is the FPS Trepang2 , which puts players in control of an escaped soldier out for revenge. This soldier has no memory of who they were, but they have been mysteriously infused with supernatural powers. Using said powers, they must fight back against those they believe did them wrong in hopes that they uncover the truth along the way. Just like with Immortals of Aveum , this leads to a pretty frantic and fast-paced adventure.

If neither of those titles are of interest to players, there are many more on offer in this month's Humble Choice. Players can grab the latest entry in the Total War franchise, Total War: Pharaoh Dynasties , which brings them back to the days of Ancient Egypt for another high-stakes strategy adventure.

City-builder fans can check out the fantastical Fabledom , those looking for a new deck builder can turn to Griftlands , roguelike and auto-battler players can take Tales & Tactics for a spin, anyone who wants to build a dungeon can jump into Naheulbeuk's Dungeon Master , and players craving a fun adventure have My Little Universe .

Subscribers Can Also Snag a Store Discount

Usually, Humble Choice also offers a few extra goodies for players to grab. However, this month the only extra comes in the form of the 20% Humble Store discount that subscribers get. So, if they are looking for any more exciting adventures to embark on, then they will definitely want to utilize it while they can.

There is so much on offer for subscribers to claim this month, and they may want to act fast as this bundle will not be here forever. It is set to expire on March 3, with a whole new batch of games replacing it on March 4.

item.title: After Hogwarts Legacy, a Sequel is Ready to Break the Bank
item.description:
To this day, Hogwarts Legacy forgoing Knuts, Sickles, and Galleons for Galleons alone is one of its odder choices. Indeed, while the final product only features Galleons as its sole currency throughout Hogsmeade and the Scottish Highlands, early Hogwarts Legacy gameplay revealed that its currency was originally divided into Knuts, Sickles, and Galleons as per the wizarding world’s canon, but at some point in development that was obviously abandoned.

Galleons are perfectly suitable as a lone currency without the need to break a bill for Sickles or Knuts, and yet that currency breakdown with bronze, silver, and gold coins remains a fun piece of established lore that is left out of Hogwarts Legacy , seemingly for simplicity’s sake. Galleons are fairly difficult to come by anyhow, and a breakdown of currency would have required Hogwarts Legacy to reevaluate its gear and purchase systems entirely. In a sequel, however, Avalanche will hopefully return to what was presumably its initial design and incorporate Knuts and Sickles in an effort to greatly expand its RPG features.

Hogwarts Legacy Left Its Pockets Empty without Knuts and Sickles

Whether it was via lines of dialogue that weren’t removed or were included nonetheless because of the undeniable importance and relevance of Harry Potter ’s wizarding currency, Hogwarts Legacy doesn’t shy away from referencing the existence of Knuts and Sickles despite not featuring them as part of the money pool players can loot or earn.

Again, Hogwarts Legacy proved that it technically didn’t need the full spectrum of coins. That said, to have such a rich currency pool not represented fully is a wasted opportunity and, if Knuts, Sickles, and Galleons were all considered at some point in development, it would appear as if Avalanche made a late decision to cut Knuts and Sickles out for whatever reason.

As it stands, looting chests in treasure vaults or enemy encampments is less engaging when a meager sum of Galleons is found alongside decorative Conjuration collection items and lackluster gear. Now, like Gobstones, Wizard’s Chess, and Quidditch, a Hogwarts Legacy sequel has a layup on its hands if it decides to fulfill its early monetary design of Knuts, Sickles, and Galleons and devise an economy around each coin’s value.

How Hogwarts Legacy 2’s Gear and Merchants Could Be Refreshing with a Revitalized Currency System

Hogwarts Legacy ’s gargantuan open world is dense enough with moment-to-moment content that it surely could have allowed for Knuts, Sickles, and Galleons to be looted. This way, ubiquitous flora and fauna ingredients could be purchased with Knuts, actual potions or plants could be purchased with Sickles, and more significant items like Conjuration spellcrafts or broomstick cosmetics could be purchased with Galleons, for example.

Hogwarts Legacy ’s Haunted Hogsmeade Shop quest exacerbates this economic issue, too, because players being able to sell whatever they wish to Penny the house-elf is no different from being able to sell to any miscellaneous merchants. Merchant pop-ups in the open world are compelling because they may offer a particular item that players can’t acquire elsewhere, but players needing to collect enough Knuts to receive Sickles and collect enough Sickles to receive Galleons would be a fantastic way to encourage progression and exploration.

A ridiculously small gear capacity inventory early on is a grave mistake in Hogwarts Legacy , but being able to sell clothing for an assortment of Knuts, Sickles, or Galleons would be a great incentive for players to hoard all they can and not destroy gear to make room for more.

If nothing else, it could help make financial choices a bit more comprehensive if players must parse how many Knuts, Sickles, or Galleons they’ll have at the end of a transaction. Plus, if a sequel had players finally visit and explore Diagon Alley, it would be exhilarating to enter Gringotts and be able to store money in a vault.

item.title: Black Ops 6 Zombies: All Liberty Falls Zombie Intel Locations
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Audio Logs in Liberty Falls
    • Audio Log #1 – Quantum Mechanical Failure
    • Audio Log #2 – Conspiracy Theorist
    • Audio Log #3 – One Lit Match
    • Audio Log #4 – The House Josiah Built
    • Audio Log #5 – The Scientist and The Moonshiner
    • Audio Log #6 – Limited Run
    • Audio Log #7 – Steel Mountain Rescue
    • Audio Log #8 – Bear Witness
    • Audio Log #9 – Money Talks
  • All Documents in Liberty Falls
    • Document #1 – We Only Take Cash
    • Document #2 – Politics, Politics
    • Document #3 – Fine Man
    • Document #4 – Final Issue
  • All Artifacts in Liberty Falls
    • Artifact #1 – Limited Transdimensional Gateway Device
    • Artifact #2 – Aetherella Statue
    • Artifact #3 – Aetheric Bowling Ball
    • Artifact #4 – Thrustodyne Model 23
    • Artifact #5 – Mr. Peeks’ Misplaced Bowling Shoes

The small town in West Virginia, Liberty Falls, has been caught up in a violent zombie outbreak, and players must answer the call from Requiem to fight the undead hordes in Black Ops 6 , and also uncover some secrets that may lead to salvation, or their undoing.

Within the Black Ops 6 Zombies map Liberty Falls, players can find a total of 18 pieces of Zombie Intel. These can range from Audio Logs, Documents, and Artifacts, which all tell their own story to better grow each Zombies player’s collection of secrets. For those seeking every Zombie Intel in Liberty Falls, a full collectibles guide can be found below.

Updated on February 10, 2025, by Jake Fillery: All Liberty Falls Intel locations can be found below, where Black Ops 6 players will be able to complete their compendium to enhance their collectibles and prove that they are the Zombies masters. There is an abundance of Zombie Intel in Liberty Falls, and we have listed them all here, along with helpful information and images that will make obtaining every audio log, document, and artifact, even easier.

All Audio Logs in Liberty Falls

Audio Log #1 – Quantum Mechanical Failure

At spawn, head right through Riverside and head into Olly’s Comics, found on the back left building when facing The Arsenal. Inside this shop, the display window will have the Quantum Mechanical Failure radio.

Audio Log #2 – Conspiracy Theorist

From Riverside, head up to Washington Avenue, where on the table with the ashtray beside the Speed Cola Perk Machine, players can find the Conspiracy Theorist radio.

Audio Log #3 – One Lit Match

After activating the SDG Generator in the Church and talking to Doctor Panos (achieved simply by interacting with the machine in the Church), players can head to the Groundskeeper’s Yard, where behind the house next to a woodpile, the One Lit Match radio can be found.

Audio Log #4 – The House Josiah Built

Head into the Cemetery, where by the West wall near to the Tier 3 Armor wall-buy, players can find this radio sitting on a wall.

Audio Log #5 – The Scientist and The Moonshiner

Head up the stairs to the second floor of the Motor Lodge Motel, where inside Room 202 behind the Jet Gun crafting bench, players can find The Scientist and The Moonshiner radio to the left of an open box of pizza.

Audio Log #6 – Limited Run

Once players have used the Jet Gun to find and collect all 9 Aetherella figurines, players can head back to Olly's Comics where this audio log will be waiting for them on the South West wall sitting on a wooden table, just by the blue door. Here's exactly how to get all 9 Aetherella figures:

Audio Log #7 – Steel Mountain Rescue

Outside of Fuller's Bowling Alley and in West Main Street, players can head past the broken Liberty Falls Transit bus to find the Steel Mountain Rescue radio on top of a garbage can by the bench at the South West wall.

Audio Log #8 – Bear Witness

Enter into the Dark Aether Church, where on the wall behind Melee Macchiato, players can find the Bear Witness radio on a bench beside a bouquet of flowers.

Audio Log #9 – Money Talks

After opening the bank vault in the Savings & Loans Bank by finding the three codes in Fuller's Liberty Lanes, Savings & Loans, and Olly Comics, players can head inside where on the left of the floor will be the Money Talks radio. Here's exactly how to enter the bank vault:

All Documents in Liberty Falls

Document #1 – We Only Take Cash

Look around the map for a black vehicle with a gold roof. Inside, the blue bunny, Mr. Peeks, should be inside. Once this car has been found, either acquire the Mangler Cannon Support weapon that can be purchased for 1,250 Salvage, or from a defeated Mangler, or use a living Mangler to shoot at the car. Doing so will see the vehicle explode, and the We Only Take Cash Document will eject from the car’s trunk.

Document #2 – Politics, Politics

Use Loot Keys from Manglers and Abominations and open lock boxes found within the Bank Vault to have a random chance of picking up the Politics, Politics Document. Any rarity of Loot Key will do, so it doesn't matter if it's uncommon or legendary.

Document #3 – Fine Man

In the Backstreet Parking area of Riverside, head to the back of the VHS store, look through the open window at the East side and shoot the three VHS tapes on the shelf for the Fine Man Document to drop.

Document #4 – Final Issue

Opposite Quick Revive in the North East corner of Olly’s Comics, players can interact with white cardboard boxes filled with comics to eject the Final Issue Document for their collection.

All Artifacts in Liberty Falls

Artifact #1 – Limited Transdimensional Gateway Device

Progress through the Liberty Falls Main Quest to craft the LTG Device on “The Alamo”, the rooftop of the Savings & Loans Bank. To craft the LTG, players must acquire the Jet Gun and then suck up all three parts:

  • To the right of Dr. Panos in the Church
  • In the ceiling in Olly's Comics
  • In the Barbershop window in Washington Vaneue

With these three parts, craft the LTG on The Alamo, found on the rooftop of the Savings & Loans bank which can be accessed outside the front entrance on West Main Street via a zipline.

Artifact #2 – Aetherella Statue

Use the Jet Gun to collect the 9 Aetherella figurines that can be found across Liberty Falls, with all 9 locations as follows:

  • South West wall of Olly's Comics, by the open blue door that leads to the alleyway.
  • North East wall of Olly's Comics, on a shelf next to the Origins poster.
  • South wall, by the display window in Olly's Comics.
  • On a shelf at the West wall in Olly's Comics, right next to the Aetherella trap.
  • Behind an A/C unit on the Yummy Freeze Rooftop when facing East, accessible by the Savings & Loans bank rooftop.
  • On top of the Motel sign in East Main Street, when facing the South wall of the Motel.
  • On an A/C unit when facing the North wall in Washington Avenue, at the same building where the valve can be acquired for the Jet Gun.
  • Look East when standing on the bus in West Main Street to the Liberty Lanes sign, where the statue is found underneath the second 'L'.
  • On the Church's closest right window when facing West in the Forecourt.

Artifact #3 – Aetheric Bowling Ball

After being teleported into Mr. Peeks’ bowling minigame, pick up the bowling ball and throw it at zombies in the bowling lanes to automatically obtain this artifact. A detailed guide on how to access the Mr. Peeks minigame is found below, but it involves shooting 5 pairs of bowling shoes:

Artifact #4 – Thrustodyne Model 23

Acquire the Jet Gun, aka the Thrustodyne Model 23, via the Mystery Box (made easier with the Wunderbar GobbleGum) or through the free crafting quest, which can be found below:

Artifact #5 – Mr. Peeks’ Misplaced Bowling Shoes

There are 5 pairs of Mr. Peeks’ bowling shoes that can be shot to acquire this collectible, and players just need to shoot one pair. The following locations are where players can shoot the bowling shoes with any gun:

  • North East wall inside Pump & Pay by the cash register.
  • On a broken shelf inside the Riverside store at the East wall.
  • Inside the groundskeeper's house, underneath the chair when facing North on Hill Street.
  • Tied to the branch of a tree outside the map in teh CEmetery when facing West, to the right of the Tier 3 Armor wall-buy.
  • To the West wall on top of a casket in the funeral room in West Main Street.

There is no reward for obtaining all Zombie Intel in Liberty Falls.

item.title: Pokemon GO Reveals Next 5 Community Day Dates
item.description:
Summary

  • Niantic announced the next 5 Pokemon GO Community Day dates for March through May 2025.
  • The first of the new Pokemon GO Community Day events will begin on March 8, four days after the Dual Destiny season ends.
  • All the Community Day events are expected to have XP bonuses, boosted Candy drops, and much more.

Niantic revealed the dates for the next five Pokemon GO Community Day events, which will all take place during the game's next season. The first of these new Community Day events will begin shortly after the next season begins on March 4 in Pokemon GO .

Niantic hosts monthly Pokemon GO Community Day events to give players more opportunities to catch new Pokemon, level up their Pokemon Trainer, and possibly encounter Shiny Pokemon. Evolving the featured Pokemon in a limited-time window grants an exclusive move that can prove to be useful in Trainer Battles, Gyms and Raids. Community Day event bonuses also include boosted Candy and Candy XL drops, along with the opportunity to catch Smeargle with the snapshot feature. With less than a month remaining in Pokemon GO Dual Destiny, Niantic revealed what players can expect in the next season.

The next five Community Day events will be held throughout March, April, and May this year in Pokemon GO , starting with the March 8 Community Day event. The season's first Community Day Classic event will begin on Saturday, March 22, followed by April's sole Community Day event on Sunday, April 27. Niantic will host Community Day and Community Day Classic events on Sunday, May 11, and Saturday, May 24, respectively. The Pokemon that will be featured for each Community Day event were not revealed yet, but Pokemon GO's Community Day Classic events usually feature Pokemon from past events.

Niantic Reveals Next Five Pokemon GO Community Day Dates

  • Saturday, March 8, 2025
  • Saturday, March 22, 2025 (Community Day Classic)
  • Sunday, April 27, 2025
  • Sunday, May 11, 2025
  • Saturday, May 24, 2025 (Community Day Classic)

The season's first Max Battle Weekend will also coincide with the March 8 Community Day event. Several other events will be held from March through May, including Catch Mastery on March 16, several Raid Day events, and the return of Shadow Raid Day on May 17. More details about Pokemon GO's next season are expected to arrive before March 4, so players will likely know more about what some of the new events entail in the coming weeks. Niantic teases that more new Pokemon GO events will be announced as well.

Along with the aforementioned event bonuses, Pokemon GO Community Day events typically offer Field Research talks and other opportunities to earn more rewards, including paid Special Research. Additional rewards are up for grabs by spinning PokeStops and participating PokeStop Showcases during the event. Before Community Day arrives, Pokemon GO players can prepare for the next season by participating in Pokemon GO Tour: Unova, which will be held in Los Angeles and New Taipei City from February 21 to February 23. The global Unova event will follow up on March 1 and 2 as the season comes to a close.

item.title: Civilization 7: How To Get A Science Victory
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Science Victory Milestone One: Trans-Atlantic Flight
  • Science Victory Milestone Two: Break The Sound Barrier
  • Science Victory Milestone Three: Launch A Satellite
  • Final Civ 7 Science Victory Condition: First Staffed Space Flight

To get a Scientific Victory in Civilization 7 , players need to do everything they can to progress through the tech tree and build high production in their Cities. This is because, to win a Science Victory, Civ 7 players must essentially complete four major City Projects after reaching close to the end of the Tech tree.

There are four steps to the Civ 7 Science Victory: Trans-Atlantic Flight, Break The Sound Barrier, Launch Satellite, and finally the capstone requirement to complete the First Staffed Space Flight project. Follow this guide to understand how to get a Science Victory in Civ 7 and get some tips on what you can do to reach a Science Victory faster.

Science Victory Milestone One: Trans-Atlantic Flight

  • Requires : Flight Technology, Aerodrome
  • Milestone Unlock : +1 Scientific Legacy Point

The first milestone in the Scientific Legacy Path in the Modern Age, and the first of three Space Race Projects Civ 7 players must complete, is the Trans-Atlantic Flight. To begin this special City Project, you must first research the Flight Technology, then build an Aerodrome in a city .

Flight is in the second half of the Modern Age Technology Tree, so you'll need to focus on Science very heavily if you want to rush the Science Victory. Civ 7 players should ensure they achieve both the Antiquity Age and Exploration Age Science Legacy Paths to build as much Science as possible throughout the game in preparation for the final push in Modern.

After you research Flight, you will unlock the ability to create an Aerodrome in a City . This unique District takes up both building slots, but allows you to spawn Aircraft units – and begin the Trans-Atlantic Flight project in that city.

Focus on Production (or Gold) to be able to build an Aerodrome faster and complete each of the four required Science Victory requirements in Civ 7 .

The unique Project will automatically grant you the first Science Legacy Path milestone and set the stage for the next step.

Science Victory Milestone Two: Break The Sound Barrier

  • Requires : Aerodynamics Technology, Aerodrome
  • Milestone Unlock : +1 Scientific Legacy Point

After you complete the first Trans-Atlantic Flight project, the next Science Legacy Path milestone in the Modern Age is unlocked after you Break The Sound Barrier. This unique City Project requires an Aerodrome , just like the first Science Victory step. You also need to research Aerodynamics .

Aerodynamics is found just a few steps ahead of Flight on the Tech tree – and requires far fewer other Techs to be researched to unlock. Focus on Science after you complete the Trans-Atlantic Flight project and you'll sail through this second step.

Once you get Aerodynamics, begin the Break The Sound Barrier project in the with an Aerodrome , and after a few turns you'll be all set for the final requirement of Modern Age Science Victory progression.

Science Victory Milestone Three: Launch A Satellite

  • Requires : Rocketry Technology, Launch Pad
  • Milestone Unlock : +1 Scientific Legacy Point, 10% more Production toward the Staffed Space Flight project for every 1 Scientific Legacy Point

The last of the three Space Race projects you must complete to unlock the last Civ 7 Science Victory condition is the Launch A Satellite project. This unique City Project requires the Rocketry Technology to be researched – the second-to-last Technology in the Modern Age tree, just before Future Tech.

Pump up your Science as high as possible to rush to this Tech , which will unlock the ability to create a Launch Pad in a City . Build the Launch Pad district in your most productive City, then start the Launch A Satellite project .

After a few turns, you will finish the Science Legacy Path in the Modern Age, and unlock the final requirement to get a Science Victory in Civ 7 : the First Staffed Space Flight.

Final Civ 7 Science Victory Condition: First Staffed Space Flight

  • Requires : ​​​​​Rocketry Technology, Launch Pad

To launch the First Staffed Space Flight, you must have completed the entire Science Legacy Path for the Modern Age . By doing this, you will already have fulfilled the Staffed Space Flight requirements to have the Rocketry Technology and a Launch Pad in a city, too .

The final Science Victory condition is remarkably simple to reach. Simply start the First Staffed Space Flight in your City with a Launch Pad , and once it is completed, you will achieve a Science Victory in Civ 7 !

If you rush Science and push for higher Technology in the Modern Age, you will likely be able to unlock a Science Victory before the Age has progressed even halfway. It's one of the simplest Victories to get in the Modern Age because of how easy each City Project is to complete, compared to the relatively complex requirements of other Civ 7 VIctories.
